appropriations: The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs requests the Committee on Finance to consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities. [3] [3] This is intended to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [3]
six_year_fiscal_implications: Your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs respectfully requests your Committee on Finance, should it deliberate on this measure, to consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities. [3] [3] This authorization would account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [3]
capital_expenditure_impact: The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs requests that the Committee on Finance consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities. [3] [3] This is to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [3]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs has requested that the Committee on Finance consider authorizing $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects. [3] This differs from the previous note which detailed a $9.9 million appropriation for specific projects. [3] The new request is to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt) to relocate the Children's Justice Center. [3]
